modelCorrections.rawOutput:
Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description and the provided example:

*Extracted text from website*: "5Pillars"
- Incorrect HTML: <html prefix="og: http://ogp.me/ns#" class=" td-md-is-chrome">
- Thought: I need to correct the above HTML by adding the "lang" attribute and assigning the appropriate language using the "Extracted text from website" for language context. The text "5Pillars" doesn't provide a clear indication of the language, but it's likely to be English. I'll add the "lang" attribute with the value "en" to specify English as the language.
- Corrected HTML: <html lang="en" prefix="og: http://ogp.me/ns#" class=" td-md-is-chrome">
